escaped_html: <p>DAWGs are very useful to eliminate suffix redundancy. However, one of the drawbacks of DAWG is that there can be several paths to get to the same node. So if it is important how you get to a node, it could cause some problems.</p>

<div class="mod" data-md="50" lang="en-CA" style="clear:none" data-hveid="CBAQEg" data-ved="2ahUKEwj3vZns1vLoAhWYsJ4KHfwFBSsQkCkwFHoECBAQEg"><!--m--><div class="PZPZlf hb8SAc" data-attrid="description" data-hveid="CBAQEw" data-ved="2ahUKEwj3vZns1vLoAhWYsJ4KHfwFBSsQziAoADAUegQIEBAT"><div jscontroller="DGEKAc" jsaction="desclink:c0XUbe;rcuQ6b:npT2md"><div jscontroller="DGEKAc" class="kno-rdesc" jsaction="sngtp:c0XUbe;tp_btn:c0XUbe;rcuQ6b:npT2md"><div><h2 class="bNg8Rb">Description</h2><span>Google News is a news aggregator app developed by Google. It presents a continuous, customizable flow of articles organized from thousands of publishers and magazines. Google News is available as an app on Android, iOS, and the Web.
Google released a beta version in September 2002 and the official app in January 2006.</span><span><span> </span><a class="q ruhjFe NJLBac fl" href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Google_News" data-ved="2ahUKEwj3vZns1vLoAhWYsJ4KHfwFBSsQmhMwFHoECBAQFA" ping="/url?sa=t&amp;source=web&amp;rct=j&amp;url=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Google_News&amp;ved=2ahUKEwj3vZns1vLoAhWYsJ4KHfwFBSsQmhMwFHoECBAQFA">Wikipedia</a></span></div></div></div></div><!--n--></div>
